item.title: The Administrative Agreement Legality Review Mechanism Establishment
item.description: Tianhao Chen Abstract The People’s Court, when adjudicating disputes over the performance of administrative agreements, needs to consider the administrative agreement’s legality and validity as a prerequisite. However, the Supreme People’s Court’s “Provisions on Several Issues Concerning the Adjudication of Administrative Agreement Cases” has not established a specific mechanism for reviewing the legality and validity of administrative agreements. Based on the Supreme People’s Court’s judicial practices regarding administrative agreements since 2015, this article, with the support of the existing regulatory framework, extracts three aspects of the legality and validity review criteria: subject authority, procedure/form, and agreement content.
